item.title: Dufour add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it. " -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The things you used to own, now they own you." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Some may never live, but the crazy never die." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Every now and then when your life gets complicated and the weasels start closing in, the only cure is to load up on heinous chemicals and then drive like a bastard from Hollywood to Las Vegas ... with the music at top volume and at least a pint of ether." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "My first time I jacked off, I thought I'd invented it. I looked down at my sloppy handful of junk and thought, This is going to make me rich." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Charles Schultz
item.description: "<b>I</b> love mankind ... it's <b>people</b> I can't stand!!" -- Charles Schultz

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All thinking men are atheists." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Isn't it pretty to think so." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It is awfully easy to be hard-boiled about everything in the daytime, but at night it is another thing." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Dufour add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Dufour add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Life's hard. It's even harder when you're stupid." -- John Wayne

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "There may be flies on you and me, but there are no flies on Jesus." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Frank Miller
item.description:
"DWIGHT:
Stay smart. Stay cool. It's time to prove to you're friends that you're worth a damn. Sometimes that means dying. Sometimes it means killing a whole lot of people." -- Frank Miller

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men." -- Plato

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Those who tell the stories rule society." -- Plato

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Virgil
item.description: "Audaces fortuna iuvat (latin)- Fortune favors the bold." -- Virgil

item.title: Dufour add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history." -- George Orwell

item.title: Dufour add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Dufour add a quote by John Foster Dulles
item.description: "The world will never have lasting peace so long as men reserve for war the finest human qualities. Peace, no less than war, requires idealism and self-sacrifice and a righteous and dynamic faith." -- John Foster Dulles
